# Subplots and Layouts

Creating multiple plots in a single figure.

## `plt.subplot()`

Simple grid system.

```python
plt.subplot(2, 1, 1) # (rows, cols, panel number)
plt.plot(x, y1)

plt.subplot(2, 1, 2)
plt.plot(x, y2)
```

## `plt.subplots()`

The Object-Oriented approach (Recommended).

```python
fig, axes = plt.subplots(nrows=2, ncols=2, figsize=(10, 8))

# Access axes by index
axes[0, 0].plot(x, y)
axes[0, 1].scatter(x, y)
axes[1, 0].hist(x)
axes[1, 1].bar(x, y)

# Adjust layout
plt.tight_layout()
```

## GridSpec

For complex layouts (spanning multiple rows/cols).

```python
grid = plt.GridSpec(2, 3, wspace=0.4, hspace=0.3)
plt.subplot(grid[0, 0])
plt.subplot(grid[0, 1:])
plt.subplot(grid[1, :2])
plt.subplot(grid[1, 2])
```
